key_points: Dusty Hill, the legendary bearded bassist of ZZ Top, has died at the age of 72.
Hill's bandmates, Billy Gibbons and Frank Beard, announced his passing on Facebook, stating he died in his sleep at his Houston home.
The cause of Dusty Hill's death was not disclosed.
Prior to his death, Hill was recovering from a hip injury that led to the cancellation of some tour dates.
Born Joe Michael Hill, he joined ZZ Top in 1970 and was a key member as the band released 15 albums.
ZZ Top's album 'Eliminator' was notably successful, selling over 10 million copies and featuring several hit songs.
The band, including Hill, was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2003.
Hill was known for his iconic beard, which both he and bandmate Gibbons grew out in the 1970s.
In 1984, Hill and Gibbons were offered $1 million by Gillette to shave their beards but declined.
Hill was replaced by the band’s guitar tech, Elwood Francis, during his recent health-related absence from the tour.
